entry.title: Git Tips
entry.content:
1. Search
git log --author=[email]
git branch --contains [commit id]
git log -S"key word" [path-to-file]
  1. Change Author
git commit --amend --author=[email]
  1. Rebase
git rebase -i HEAD~[number_of_commits]
edit
git commit --amend
git rebase --continue
  1. Reset
git reset --hard [commit-id]
git reset --soft @{1}
git reset --hard HEAD
git reset --hard HEAD^
  1. Remote
git branch -r
git remote show origin
  1. Find commit list which contains [function]
git show `git log --oneline [path-to-file] | cut -c 1-8` | egrep -rs "[function]|commit"
  1. Diff
git log --oneline [tag1]..[tag2]
git log --oneline [branch1]..[branch2]

entry.title: Github Pages and Octopress
entry.content:
Easy way to create and write your own blog.

Create new repository in github

ex. eyan0221.github.io.git

Install rvm

curl -L https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable
rvm install 1.9.3
rvm use 1.9.3
ruby --version

Setup Octopress

git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git octopress
cd octopress/
gem install bundler
bundle install
rake install

Deploy Github Pages

sudo apt-get install nodejs
rake setup_github_pages
rake generate
rake deploy
git push git@github.com:eyan0221/eyan0221.github.io.git source

Reference

  • http://zerodie.github.io/blog/2012/01/19/octopress-github-pages/
  • http://octopress.org/docs/setup/
